title: International Medical Graduates
author: Web Experience Toolkit

cleaned_text: International Medical Graduates Are you an International Medical Graduate interested in a career in medicine in Prince Edward Island? If so, this information that may help: For International medical specialists Visit the [Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada](http://www.royalcollege.ca/rcsite/home-e) for information on how to obtain eligibility to write specialist exams. If you already have Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada certification (FRCPC), [visit PEI specialist career opportunities](/en/topic/specialist-opportunities). For International family medicine physicians Visit the [Medical Council of Canada](http://www.mcc.ca) for information about qualifying exams. In most cases, one to two years of independent clinical experience in Canada is required. Note: Observership and volunteer work in Canada does not count toward independent clinical practice experience. Once you have confirmed your eligibility to work and be licensed in Prince Edward Island, visit physician job opportunities at [www.healthjobspei.ca](https://healthjobspei.ca/) Published date: February 13, 2020
